p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) belongs to the Togaviridae family, Alphavirus genus [ 1, 2, 3], and it has been responsible for emerging and reemerging outbreaks in several tropical and temperate regions of the world [ 4, 5]. It is an arbovirus maintained in nature by a transmission cycle involving vertebrate hosts and hematophagous mosquitoes of Aedes (Ae.) genus, especially Ae. aegypti and Ae. albopictus in urban cycles [ 6, 7, 8], and humans are the only host capable of developing the clinical forms of the disease.
